meanings.definition: To require or involve as an antecedent condition.
meanings.sent1: The recipe presupposes that you have all the ingredients ready before you start cooking.
meanings.sent2: His plan presupposes a high level of commitment from all team members.
meanings.sent3: The game presupposes that players will follow the rules, but what if they decide to play their own way?
meanings.sent4: Her success presupposes a strong foundation of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The theory presupposes that every action has a consequence, whether positive or negative.

meanings.definition: To suppose or assume beforehand; take for granted.
meanings.sent1: The detective presupposes the suspect's innocence until proven guilty.
meanings.sent2: She presupposes that her students will excel if given the right support and resources.
meanings.sent3: The magician presupposes that the audience will be amazed by his tricks, but what if they figure out the secrets?
meanings.sent4: His argument presupposes that everyone shares the same values, which may not always be the case.
meanings.sent5: The theory presupposes that nature will always find a way to adapt and survive.
